definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
lit. sandpiper and clam war together (and the fisherman catches both) (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
(bird species of China) Eurasian woodcock (Scolopax rusticola)
(bird species of China) spoon-billed sandpiper (Eurynorhynchus pygmeus)
(bird species of China) Asian dowitcher (Limnodromus semipalmatus)
(bird species of China) pied avocet (Recurvirostra avosetta)
(bird species of China) Far Eastern curlew (Numenius madagascariensis)
(bird species of China) great knot (Calidris tenuirostris)
(bird species of China) least sandpiper (Calidris minutilla)
(bird species of China) jack snipe (Lymnocryptes minimus)
(bird species of China) little curlew (Numenius minutus)
(bird species of China) little stint (Calidris minuta)
(bird species of China) Nordmann's greenshank (Tringa guttifer)

sentences.english: The knot is a dumpy, short-legged, wading bird.
sentences.chinese: 濱鷸是一種矮胖的短腳涉禽。

sentences.english: New World curlew that breeds in northern North America.
sentences.chinese: 在北美洲北部繁殖的新大陸杓鷸。

sentences.english: The clam immediately closed his shells and tightly clamped the snipe's beak.
sentences.chinese: 河蚌爲了保命，趕緊將硬殼合上，緊緊夾住了鷸的嘴。

sentences.english: The knots, it turns out, aren't getting enough horseshoe crab eggs to eat.
sentences.chinese: 事實證明，紅腹濱鷸沒有喫到足夠的馬蹄蟹卵。

sentences.english: However, nationally important numbers of Curlew, Redshank and Golden Plover were also recorded.
sentences.chinese: 然而，數量最多的是杓鷸，腳鷸和灰斑鴴也被記錄到。

sentences.english: However, nationally important numbers of Curlew, Redshank and Golden Plover were also recorded.
sentences.chinese: 然而，數量最多的是杓鷸，腳鷸和灰斑鴴也被記錄到。

sentences.english: Greenshank and red grouse may also be affected in the same way.
sentences.chinese: 類似的影響也會發生在青足鷸和紅松雞身上。

sentences.english: Numenius phaeopus is the new record in Reserve.
sentences.chinese: 中杓鷸爲鄱陽湖保護區的新記錄。

sentences.english: A flock of black-necked stilts glides over the waters surrounding Long Island in the Bahamas.
sentences.chinese: 一羣灰頸長腳鷸掠過環繞巴哈馬的長島水域。

sentences.english: A snipe saw the clam and wanted to enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 一隻鷸鳥看見河蚌，就想美餐一頓。

sentences.english: Despite all its efforts, the snipe could not extricate its bill.
sentences.chinese: 鷸鳥用盡力氣，也拔不出它的喙來。

sentences.english: Large plover like sandpiper of North American fields and uplands .
sentences.chinese: 北美曠野和的大型類鴴的磯鷸。

sentences.english: Wilcove seems to think the red knot population has stabilized.
sentences.chinese: 威爾考烏似乎認爲紅腹濱鷸的數量已經穩定了下來。

sentences.english: A woodcock flushed from its cover.
sentences.chinese: 一隻蘭鷸從藏身處驚飛而起。

sentences.english: Imagine that there is some activity — say, snipe hunting — that members of Congress want to encourage.
sentences.chinese: 想象一下國會議員想要鼓勵某項活動，比如說獵鷸。

sentences.english: Thanks to Ho Fai for pointing out the difference between greenshank and Nordmann's greenshank.
sentences.chinese: 多謝輝哥指出青腳鷸和小青腳鷸的分別。

definition: (bound form, used in the names of various kinds of bird, esp. robins and redstarts)
